document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Simon

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Scopocira dentichelis
Simon, 1900
: 385
(Male holotype from Mariquita, Orinoco, Venezuela , deposited in MNHN , examined);
Simon, 1901
: 444
, figs 496‒498 ;
Galiano, 1963
: 437
, pl. XXXVI, figs 1‒6 ; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .

Scopocira panamena
Chamberlin & Ivie, 1936
: 28
, pl. 8 , figs 58‒60 (Male holotype from Barro Colorado Island, Panama , deposited in MCZ , examined);
Chickering, 1946
: 103
, figs 96‒97 ; World Spider Catalog, 2014 .
NEW SYNONYMY .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 65–70.
S. tenella
, spinnerets. 65 female, anterior lateral; 66 female, posterior medians; 67 female, posterior lateral; 68 male, anterior lateral; 69 male, posterior medians; 70 male, posterior lateral. ac = aciniform spigot; MAP = major ampullate spigot; mAP = minor ampullate spigot; n = nubbin; pi = piriform spigot.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
S. dentichelis
(
Figs 20
, 113 ) are similar to those of
S. pterodactyla
(
Figs 50
, 175 ) by having the sperm duct opening at the base of the embolus, but can be recognized by not having an acute paraembolic projection like that present in
S. pterodactyla
. Females of this species resemble those of
S. histrio
, both in coloration (compare
Fig. 111
with Fig. 159 ) and by the slender, folded spermathecae (
Figs 116
, 161), but can be recognized by the presence of rims on the lateral fields ventrally on the epigynal plate (
Fig. 115
).

Female ( FSCA from Tobago , Delaford). Total length: 3.13 . Carapace light brown, 1.50 long, 1.06 wide, 0.71 high (
Fig. 111
). Ocular quadrangle lighter, 0.84 long, with a transverse dark stripe between the posterior eyes. Thoracic area dark brown with a pair of oblique light stripes. Anterior eye row 1.06 wide and posterior 1.00 wide. Legs 4123 , as in male. Length of femur: I 0.93 , II 0.73 , III 0.70 , IV 1.01 ; patella + tibia: I 1.26 , II 0.86 , III 0.80 , IV 1.20 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 0.87 , II 0.69 , III 0.77 , IV 1.02 . Spination as in male. Abdomen cream-colored, with dorsal and lateral dark brown pattern (
Figs 111‒112
); ventrally cream-colored. Epygine as in
Figs 115‒116
.
